channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024010738
item.description:
Report X-2024010738

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OOLTEWAH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to internal leakage from bottle within package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2024010739
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: An inbound sticker on the bottom of the box suggests that the box was turned upside down contrary to the orientation arrows. Action taken is unknown. DescribePack: The threads of the cap were crossed causing a faulty seal and leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in an open contents bins and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010523
item.description:
Report X-2024010523

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a steel drum fell between two dollies and was crushed. The damage to the drum caused a crack in the wall of the drum resulting in a release. The steel drum was placed into a steel salvage package. When the shipper was contacted for a new declaration they asked that the shipment be disposed of hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024010151
item.description:
Report X-2024010151

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=774676995691 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=1202 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=diesel Fuel PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=B - Glass# porcelain# or stoneware NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter TECH NAME=Diesel Fuell )A fiberboard box was brought to the MEMH spill office as an odor. While investigating the shipment it was discovered that two of the five 1L gloss bottles inside had broken. The bottles were packaged inside of plastic bag with absorbent pad and styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024010608
item.description:
Report X-2024010608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A MEMH spill agent was dispatched to the international input for a leaking package. The spill agent was told that the fiberboard box had fallen off the rollers and started to leak. While investigating the shipment the agent observed that the single drum inside was bent causing the lid to open and spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The drum was placed into a steel salvage package and will be returned to the shipper after a new declaration has been obtained.

item.title: Report X-2024010561
item.description:
Report X-2024010561

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained four 1 gallon plastic jugs. The cap was loose on one of the plastic jugs causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:

  • State: TN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations. Inside of the fiberboard box were four smaller boxes. One of the smaller boxes contained two glass bottles inside of fiberboard sleves. One of the glass bottles broke spilling its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contetns were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024010524
item.description:
Report X-2024010524

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard package with signa of release was discovered during sort operations a the MEMH facility. The fiberboard package contained three on gallon paint cans separated with fiberboard dividers with bubble wrap for dunnage. One of the cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for a new decloration for movement.

The cap of the jerrycan was loose causing the release. The cap was tightened and the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024010526
item.description:
Report E-2024010526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail of ink was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel overpacked the damaged 5-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and cleaners to wipe down the impacted trailer and dock floors. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the one (1) damaged 5-gallon jug and spent absorbent pads was generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2024010371
item.description:
Report X-2024010371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Dec 28th during the PM sort a package was found that had a odor and when picked up sounded like broken glass was inside. The package was marked as UN1197, Extracts, Liquid, 3, III with the proper marking and labels on the outer package. One of the glass bottles inside broke during shipment and leaked the entire contents of the bottle. The spill was cleaned and the package was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010396

Report X-2024010396

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment of perfumery products was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 10 glass bottles of Brandt Perfume @ 100 ml each. Wrapped in bubble wrap inside of a cardboard box shipped as UN 1266, Ltd Qty. Placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the recipent.
